file_content.text: I got your message. Have you really found him?
I can sense him even now.
I received your message. And now that I'm here... I sense it too.
We grow closer every moment. Our former Emperor is out there.
Do we know what could have brought him to this area? My ship's charts don't have much.
I wonder where he's headed.
There are rumors of many civilizations in this region, but our only outposts nearby were destroyed without explanation some time ago. The culprits were never determined.
What will we do when we find him? We still don't know how to destroy him.
Can we even hurt him?
If he has taken on a physical form, we will destroy it. That should at least weaken him significantly.
...As you well know.
If he remains incorporeal... at least we will know where to strike, even if we don't know how.
The sooner we destroy him, the better. He's held us away from our potential for far too long.
Not "former" enough for me.
Agreed.
The sooner we take him out, the better. Saving the galaxy is great, but I've got better-paying jobs I want to get back to.
Not "former" enough for me.
Your questionable associates can wait.
Your former Emperor. The Jedi have been trying to stop him from the beginning.
He was never my Emperor.
Your former Emperor. The Republic was smart enough to want him dead from the start.
He was never my Emperor.
He never served your interests. But there was a time when he served ours.
Why travel so far? Why consume every living thing on Ziost, then turn and flee into the depths of Wild Space?
He definitely didn't sound afraid the last time we spoke. Could this all just be a game to him?
Probably just toying with us.
We'll soon find out.
For all his shows of power, he must have a weakness, or he wouldn't have stopped with Ziost.
He must be vulnerable.
That would be reassuring, wouldn't it.
He's mad with power. We can't expect him to act logically.
There's no logic--he's insane.
Perhaps you're right.
Between the two of us, I'm confident we can press the Dark Council into line....
If we do locate him, I believe I can press the Dark Council into line....
But what of the Republic? The cooperation we've received has been beneficial... but limited. And apparently unofficial. Will your government help destroy this threat?
I can't speak for the Supreme Chancellor. But I'm certain the Jedi will not let this danger go unchecked.
The Jedi will.
I'm an officer, but I'm no general. I can't speak for anyone outside of my squad.
That's not up to me.
I do a lot of work for the Republic, sure, but what you're asking is a bit out of my area, you know?
I'm not the person to ask.
I'm told the Chancellor has contacted you personally. More than once. Perhaps you could contact her next time....
The kind of trust you're asking for isn't easy.
You're a hard person to trust.
I don't need trust. I only need power--enough to destroy our shared enemy.
Chancellor Saresh will never give up the war. This is on us, and whoever we can convince to help on our word.
No way.
Then we will have to be enough.
But I'm beginning to doubt the Republic will make any serious contributions. Their assistance here has been useful, but limited.
There are at least a few people in the Republic who can be reasoned with. I could contact Theron Shan.
They can be reasonable.
He is a spy. But... if we have no other means....
With or without the Republic... this has to be done. We'll find a way.
We'll get by either way.
We'll see.
The Republic and the Jedi took their shot at the Emperor. They failed. We don't need them mucking about any further.
Leave the Republic out.
The Republic isn't ready to do what needs to be done. They'd just get in our way.
You're better off this way.
Hm. Perhaps you're right.
They're the enemy. They always will be. We shouldn't even involve them this much.
Let the Republic burn.
Against this threat, any living being should be an ally. Our other conflicts can be resumed later.
My lord! Sensor contact, fifteen clicks. Small... no life form readings... some kind of probe?
Raise shields. Pursue and destroy.
Why would someone send a probe out this far? Some kind of survey?
A probe? Out here?
We can find out from the wreckage.
If we could take the probe in one piece, we could learn much more about who's spying on us.
Capture it.
Wreckage can teach us enough. And it can't transmit our location.
Careful, Marr. This could be an ambush.
It could be baiting us.
It will certainly become one if we allow a probe to escape.
Evasive maneuvers! Come about 180 degrees!
We've been boarded! All decks report hostile forces!
I'll sweep for boarders. You get us out of here!
Set deflectors to double aft! Divert weapon power to the engines!
Readings are identical to scans from the unknown force that attacked Korriban!
